content.title: Divyang Boys/ Girls Marriage Incentive Grant
content.beneficiary: Divyang youths/ girls who are about to get married
content.details: Divyang Youth / Girl Marriage Incentive Grant is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to a couple when a young woman or young man marries a Divyang (person with disability) partner.
eligibility: For the Boys (Groom): The youth must be citizens of India.
The youth must be permanent residents of Uttarakhand or have been domiciled there for at least five years.
The youth himself or his partner should belong to the Person with Disabilities (PWD) category having at least 40% disability.
The youth should not be convicted in a criminal case.
The youth must be at least 21 years and not more than 45 years at the time of marriage.
The youth should be married according to the prevailing social customs or a legal marriage has been solemnized by a competent court.
The youth should not be an income tax payer.
The youth should not have a pre-existing wife.
The youth should not be facing charges of molestation or any other criminal case.
For the Girls (Bride): The girl must be a citizen of India.
The girl must be permanent residents of Uttarakhand or have been domiciled there for at least five years.
The girl herself or her partner should belong to the Person with Disabilities (PWD) category having at least 40% disability.
The girl should not be convicted in a criminal case.
The girl must be at least 18 years and not more than 45 years at the time of marriage.
The girl should be married according to the prevailing social customs or a legal marriage has been solemnized by a competent court.
The girl should not be an income tax payer.
The girl should not have a pre-existing husband.
content.application_process: Offline. Step 1: Prescribed format can be collected from the nearest office of the Assistant Social Welfare Officer. Step 2: Fill the form properly and attach all the documents (attested, if required). Step 3: Submit the form to the nearest office of the Assistant Social Welfare Officer.
documents_required: Photocopy of Unique Disability ID Card.
Certificate of Permanent Residence/ Proof of Residence in the State for 5 years.
Self-declaration of not being an income tax payer.
Self-declaration of not being involved in criminal activities.
Self-declaration of not having a pre-existing spouse.

faqs.question: What is the objective 'Divyang Youth/ Girl Marriage Incentive Grant'?
faqs.answer: 'Divyang Youth /Girl Marriage Incentive Grant' is a social security scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides financial assistance to a couple when a young woman or young man marries a Divyang (person with disability) partner.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has been launched by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand.

faqs.question: Who are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Divyang youths/ girls who are about to get married are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: What kind of financial assistance can be availed through this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of ₹25,000/- is provided to the beneficiaries to cover their expenses of marriage.

faqs.question: What should be the age criteria for the youths and girls?
faqs.answer: The youth should be between 21-45 years of age and the girl should be between 18-45 years of age.

faqs.question: What should be the income criteria for the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: There is no specific income criteria for the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: From where the format for the application can be collected?
faqs.answer: Prescribed format can be collected from the nearest office of the Assistant Social Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Where can the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: Filled application form should be submitted to the office of the Assistant Social Welfare Officer.
